classification.reason: Peaked 215%, now 54% â€” crashed 161% from peak

tweets.hook: $MNDR ran +215% then crashed -161% in 7 days. Classic ATM dilution trap! ðŸ§µ
breakdown: Here's what happened: $MNDR filed an ATM shelf (424B5) letting them sell new shares anytime. Stock ran +215% on hype. Company saw the spike and started dumping shares into YOUR buy orders.
The math: Filed 11/13. Peaked +215% by day 4. Now? Only +54%. That -161% drop? That's dilution in action. Company got cash, latecomers got bags.
The lesson: When you see a small cap spike right after an ATM filing, ask yourself - who's selling into this rally? Often it's the company itself. The pattern repeats.
The play: Watch for ATM filings. If a stock spikes hard, consider that dilution might be loading up to crash the party. Trade with caution.

chartAnnotations.volumeNote: High volume on peak day, tapering off as price drops.

rationale: Understanding ATM dilution helps traders avoid buying into a pump only to hold the bags as the price collapses.
